title: Add magit-status style buffer for bd ready tickets
description:
Implement a transient-based interactive buffer similar to magit-status that displays all tickets returned by `bd ready`. The buffer should:

- Display tickets in a clean, organized format
- Show key ticket information (ID, title, priority, type)
- Support interactive actions (view details, claim ticket, etc.)
- Use transient.el for the UI like magit does
- Refresh on demand
- Integrate with existing emacs-beads infrastructure

title: Implement section rendering for beads-show

- test/beads-show-sections-tests.el

Implement section rendering using magit-section:

title: Implement markdown renderer for beads-show
description:
Implement markdown parsing and font-lock based syntax highlighting for issue content.

Design Reference: docs/design/bd-319f-beads-show.md - Phase 4, Markdown Rendering

Files to extend:
- beads-show-markdown.el
- test/beads-show-markdown-tests.el
design:
Implement markdown rendering with font-lock:

1. beads-show-markdown-parse (content):
   - Parse markdown to syntax tree
   - Identify: headings, lists, code, links, emphasis
   - Return structure for font-lock

2. Font-lock matchers:
   - Heading matcher (# through ######)
   - List item matcher (- * 1. 2.)
   - Code block matcher (``` and `)
   - Link matcher ([text](url))
   - Emphasis matcher (** and *)

3. beads-show-markdown-apply-highlighting (buffer):
   - Apply font-lock-keywords to buffer
   - Enable font-lock-mode
   - Respect beads-show-use-markdown-mode custom var

4. Graceful degradation:
   - If markdown disabled, show plain text
   - Handle malformed markdown

Use font-lock-add-keywords. Reference markdown-mode for patterns.
acceptance_criteria:
- Markdown headings highlighted correctly
- Lists (ordered/unordered) highlighted
- Code blocks (inline and block) highlighted
- Links highlighted and recognizable
- Emphasis (bold/italic) highlighted
- beads-show-use-markdown-mode controls behavior
- Plain text fallback works
- Buttercup tests for all syntax types
- Performance acceptable for large content
- No compilation warnings

title: Implement beads-show: completing-read interface and magit-style issue viewer
description: Create M-x beads-show command with completing-read interface for all issues, showing priority, type, and title. Selected issues display in a magit-section-mode derived buffer with navigation, markdown rendering, and clickable labels. Implementation primarily in beads-show.el.
design:
Main components:
1. Data layer: bd list --json parsing to alist representation
2. Presentation layer: completing-read formatter (priority, type, title), marginalia formatter (labels), magit-section buffer renderer
3. Interaction: RET navigation, q to quit
4. Configuration: custom var for markdown mode
5. Testing: buttercup tests for both formatters

The implementation will leverage existing async machinery from beads-process.el.
acceptance_criteria:
- M-x beads-show displays completing-read with formatted issues
- Issue selection opens magit-section buffer with full details
- Dependencies are navigable with RET
- Labels are clickable (stub for now)
- q deletes the buffer
- Markdown content is properly rendered
- Both formatters have buttercup tests

title: Document issue alist structure and create helper functions
description:
Document the issue alist structure from beads-issue.el and create lightweight helper functions for accessing fields. This provides a clear interface for later agents while keeping flexibility.

Design Reference: docs/design/bd-319f-beads-show.md - Phase 1, Core Data Layer

Files to create:
- beads-show-core.el
- test/beads-show-core-tests.el

Note: Using alist representation from beads-issue.el. May need to revisit with stronger typing in future wave if interface proves too unstructured.
design:
Document and provide helpers for issue alist structure:

1. Document issue alist structure (from beads-issue.el):
   - Keys: :id, :title, :description
   - Keys: :issue-type, :status, :priority  
   - Keys: :labels, :dependencies
   - Keys: :created-at, :updated-at, :closed-at
   - All keys use kebab-case

2. Helper/accessor functions:
   - beads-show--issue-id (issue)
   - beads-show--issue-title (issue)
   - beads-show--issue-type (issue)
   - beads-show--issue-status (issue)
   - etc.

3. Section type definitions (still needed):
   - defconst for section types: header, metadata, description, dependencies, labels

4. Buffer state structure (lightweight alist):
   - current-issue
   - section-visibility (alist of section-id -> t/nil)
   - navigation-history (list of issue-ids)

Use simple alist-get wrappers. Keep it lightweight and flexible.
acceptance_criteria:
- Issue alist structure clearly documented in comments
- Helper functions for all common fields
- Section type constants defined
- Buffer state alist structure documented
- Helper functions tested with buttercup
- Examples showing typical usage
- No custom structs (keeping it flexible)
- No compilation warnings

title: Implement data access layer for beads-show
description:
Implement repository queries and issue data fetching/parsing with async support and caching.

Design Reference: docs/design/bd-319f-beads-show.md - Phase 1, Core Data Layer

Files to extend:
- beads-show-core.el
- test/beads-show-core-tests.el
design:
Implement data access functions leveraging beads-process.el:

1. beads-show--fetch-issues (callback)
   - Call `bd list --json` via beads-process-call
   - Parse JSON using beads-issue-parse-json-issues
   - Cache results in beads-show--issues variable
   - Call callback with parsed issue list

2. beads-show--fetch-issue (id callback)
   - Call `bd show --json ID` via beads-process-call
   - Parse JSON using beads-show-issue-parse-json-issue
   - Call callback with parsed issue

3. Issue list caching:
   - defvar beads-show--issues nil
   - Cache invalidation function
   - TTL or manual refresh

4. Error handling:
   - JSON parse errors
   - Process failures
   - Network issues
   - User-friendly error messages

Reference beads-create.el for async patterns.
acceptance_criteria:
- beads-show--fetch-issues function works async
- beads-show--fetch-issue function works async
- JSON parsing handles all issue fields correctly
- Issue list caching works with invalidation
- Error handling gracefully handles all failure cases
- Callback mechanism tested thoroughly
- Integration tests with mocked bd commands
- Buttercup tests cover success and error paths
- No compilation warnings

4. Add buttercup tests for the parsing functions in beads-issue.el
acceptance_criteria:

- beads-issue.el contains tested issue parsing/data functions
- All existing functionality still works
- Tests pass for issue parsing functions

title: Implement buffer management for beads-show
description:
Implement issue detail buffer creation, refresh, and state management for beads-show.

Design Reference: docs/design/bd-319f-beads-show.md - Phase 3, Issue Detail Buffer

Files to create:
- beads-show-buffer.el
- test/beads-show-buffer-tests.el
design:
Implement buffer management:

1. beads-show-issue-mode (derived from magit-section-mode):
   - Major mode for issue detail display
   - Key bindings: q (quit), g (refresh), TAB (cycle section)
   - Read-only buffer

2. beads-show--display-issue (issue):
   - Create or reuse buffer "*beads: ISSUE-ID*"
   - Render issue using section functions
   - Layout: header → metadata → description → dependencies → labels
   - Apply markdown highlighting to content sections

3. beads-show-refresh:
   - Re-fetch current issue
   - Re-render buffer
   - Preserve section visibility state

4. Buffer state management:
   - buffer-local variable for current issue
   - buffer-local variable for section states
   - Navigation history

Use pop-to-buffer for display. Reference magit-status buffer management.
acceptance_criteria:
- beads-show-issue-mode defined and functional
- beads-show--display-issue creates buffer correctly
- Buffer shows all issue fields in proper sections
- Markdown content rendered with highlighting
- Refresh (g) re-fetches and re-renders
- Quit (q) kills buffer
- Buffer-local state tracked correctly
- Multiple issue buffers can coexist
- Buttercup tests for buffer lifecycle
- Integration tests for full display
- No compilation warnings
